title: Slow service long queus!
body:
The hospital is not as bad as many reviews mention however, there's always a huge queue and only half the staff working at the phlebotomy department! 

Would like to suggest that dietetic people join the anti-coagulation queu please.

As we normally have to get our blood tests done whilst fasting and, this can be quiet difficult...
Diabetic people can understand what i am talking about... 
Thanks

readBy.name: The Hillingdon Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Please Answer the Phone
body:
Once you clear the waiting list, the service is pretty good. I needed to review my treatment but the phone is never answered.

In the end I actually went to the reception desk at Broad Street, no one was there, but the phone was ringing....

Still trying to get in touch after two weeks just to get my insoles adjusted.

title: Poor service
body:
I came into the hospital by ambulance roughly at 12 in the afternoon I had a high temperature soninhad slippers and a tracksuit on that's it after being checked in I was told to sit out side and wait after telling the doctors I am having difficulties breathing dizziness my lower back and my abdominal was in agony and I have the runs I was called in after 2 and a half hours to get checked give blood and urine sample I am absolutely frozen the doctor asked me to wait outside I was not happy but I did see there were people with serious illnesses to me.
I totally understand the doctors and nurses are rushed of there feet but when I'm trying to ask someone for a gown or something to keep me warm I'm being ignored I feel faint and helpless why does everything take 5 hours it's a joke I just need to lie down I've been told to drink water and rest but was not given anything to drink or keep warm I am disgusted with the treatment.
The doctor I had was helpful but he could only do so much.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: water sample not checked
body: Took a water sample over to surgery today around midday to get checked for water infection, as getting an appointment here is a non starter! I was told it would not take long to get it checked they would let me know, Heard nothing so  Rang back at 16.18pm was told it not been checked, and it would be checked by doctor and they would ring me back , again Heard nothing, I called them at 18.01 Only to be told it still not been checked and  doctor has now gone home.. This is totally unacceptable. This surgery has gone from Bad to Worse...

readBy.name: NHS Medway CCG

title: Terrible service, can't get an appointment
body: I tried to book an appointment with a doctor as I felt very unwell. I haven't been to see a GP for at least 5 years and try not to trouble them as I know they are really busy. I phoned and was offered an appointment with a nurse practitioner, when I said that I wanted to see a doctor I was told I would have to wait until February, I said I could be dead by then. I was advised to ring 111. I've been a light service user, worked full time since the age of 16 (currently 49) and appalled that I can't get an appointment with a doctor. I've given up and hope I'm not too unwell. NHS needs reforming, the service is poor and definitely not worth my tax paid in. Do they have too many patients? Am I suffering because of other people abusing the system, it's not good enough. I absolutely would not recommend this practice. Stonyhill medical center are not there when you need their support, they don't seem to care if you need to see a GP. I'd give them 0/10.

title: Excellent Care
body: My mum needed to attend for a x-ray after being referred by her GP with acute back pain.  Mum was very anxious about having to lie down due to the pain she was in.  The radiologist was so understanding of Mum's situation and helped her through the whole process until the images were completed. We cannot thank you enough for your kindness and courtesy shown to Mum.  She experienced such lovely focused patient care.

title: A let down
body: The staff are rude, and are inappropriate with clients, smoking with them. Bad care/service overall. Do not recommend this service.

title: Judgmental and Inappropriate
body: I visited the Northern Medical Centre as someone who has registered with them in the past few months, having previously been registered at my university‚Äôs practice, and you can tell that their outlooks on contraception are very different. I attended the walk-in clinic for emergency contraception, and was pretty promptly seen. Unfortunately the staff member I saw frowned at my request, rolled their eyes and speaking in a condescending tone, eventually handing me the prescription and remarking that next time I should consider using other methods and be more prepared. Not taking into account that perhaps other contraceptive methods had failed and that‚Äôs why I had come to see them. I was appalled at this attitude of shaming and prejudice, this is exactly the sort of incident that would put patients off seeking help for contraception. dangerous and unprofessional.

title: Fantastic care
body:
I was admitted by ambulance on a Sunday evening. Every member of staff who cared for me was kind, helpful and made me feel very safe and looked after. It was very busy but I was kept well informed of the plan of my care. I was impressed how calm the staff were with all the patients they had to deal with and what could have been a very frightening time was made much easier by such good care.
I was also impressed by how bright and clean the department was which can‚Äôt be easy when it‚Äôs so busy.
Thank you the care given was appreciated.

readBy.name: Taunton and Somerset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Terrible surgery
body: Doctors say one thing nurses another send for you make a appointment then tell you you do not need one when you are there phone reception cannot get through go to the surgery promised a phone call next day don‚Äôt receive one ring up told it will be next day surprise no phone call still waiting 10 days later imagine what other mistakes are made

title: Traumatising experience in gynaecology
body: I am really saddened and shocked at my care at treatment at NUH for a fibroid issue. Whilst I do not want to go into detail I have had no access to treatment for this for almost 3 years and instead have been exposed to communication errors, surgery cancellations, inappropriate treatment and therefore wasted time, 5 different consultants.. the list goes on. I am very distressed today to have learned that my surgery has been cancelled for the 4th time in 5 months. I have not been given another date. I am very upset and shocked that this is continuing to happen to me. I do not feel looked after by the service, I do not feel like anyone cares about me nor do I feel that I am anyone‚Äôs priority. I am utterly appalled and feel this is experience is constantly traumatising with absolutely no resolution to my difficulties and horrific symptoms in almost 3 years. I‚Äôm very worried about the time when I actually get my surgery and whether I will be adequately looked after given the horrendous and appalling way I have been treated as a human being so far. Awful. Awful. Awful.

readBy.name: Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: rubbish
body:
dont even know if my doctor actually exists!  reception are clearly running the place, with patients been deferred to nurses.... who do what they can.  

I've been a patient for over 5years.  never seen a doctor there.

title: Excellent care
body:
I visited this department today and was seen by an excellent consultant and a truly lovely nurse. They were sympathetic and went to great care to explain things thoroughly and candidly. 
I felt listened to and treated with compassion and understanding. They were both encouraging. Too often I've found trips to the hospital can be a bit dehumanising and I certainly didn't feel that today. I've got a clear treatment plan and I understand what happens next.
Thank you to both these practitioners for a good experience.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Chaotic appointment systems
body: My son has attended the dermatology outpatient dept over a few years. At each appointment the consultant/ specialist indicates when they next want to see him. This often relates to a medication review/ repeat script which CANNOT be obtained from a GP. Three times we have received a cancellation of the appointment and an alternative which is 4-6 months later, ie well after the medication review is required. This once led to my son having his course of treatment stopped before it was complete, a clinical risk.

title: Horrible nurses
body: The nurse was the worst and most inhumane careless person I have ever encountered. The way she took my blood, I felt like I‚Äôm being butchered.. my veins are very visible and easy to navigate yet she clearly disliked me and struggled to do it over a number of times. Afterwards, I was placed in a room and I could see her standing outside smirking and pointing at me while laughing with a colleague of hers - made me feel extremely uncomfortable! I had to wait a little over 5 hours for my blood test results. Additionally, there was a patient with a broken ankle and the doctor was arguing with the nurse just outside his room regarding the position he was placed in - while the patient could hear the whole conversation. He thought his leg won‚Äôt be able to heal due to the comments of the doctors.. disturbing, unprofessional and unacceptable.

title: Bowel scope screening
body:
Endoscopy unit
wasn't worried about the actual procedure was worried about the results, however the staff I encountered on 23 Jan in the evening were the most professional that I have ever encountered in any hospital visit, made to feel at ease through the whole procedure, staff took care to explain exactly what was happening at any time.
if any males are reading this and are scared of the procedure then forget your alpha male status and let the staff look after you if they treat you as they did me then they are your friends for life hopefully a long one after they have done their job.
Totally painless, your dignity still intact so get the job done
Many thanks to staff I encountered

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic Nurse
body: The Nurse at this surgery was fantastic today. I had to have a smear test which I wasn‚Äôt looking forward too but the nurse put my mind at rest and was so careful with me. I have had a smear test several times before and never felt this relaxed! Thank you to the nurse you are doing a great job

title: Excellent practice
body: I phoned the practice on Monday morning with a worrying concern and was very pleased to be seen by a doctor that same evening. She examined me and reassured me that all was well but to be on the safe side still referred me to Bassetlaw hospital where I was seen by a specialist a couple of days later where after tests all was well, nothing to worry about! I cannot fault the wonderful care and swift action by this doctor at the surgery. I would like to say, "Thank you very much!" I would definitely recommend this practice.

title: Unprofessional, judgemental Doctor
body: disappointing and unprofessional GP that I have ever had. The GP does not listen or care about your concerns or issues, never offered any advice or help but yet judges you without ever meeting or discussing the matter in hand. If you want to stay healthy and with good mental heath steer well away from this practice and some of its GP,s. Very, very unprofessional.

title: Fabulous Care from WONDERFUL staff
body:
We want to thank everyone who was involved in the care of our son not just in Courtlands, where he spent most of the time, but in A and E and then the Emergency ward as well. All members of staff, without exception, were lovely, lovely, caring professional people and they need to be thanked for doing what they do. 
Interestingly, it is easy to find the 'complaints department' but when we looked for the 'compliments department' we had no joy ‚òπÔ∏è.  
Thank you to all of you for being so fabulous; what you do is very much appreciated and whilst it would be nice to see you all again, I hope we don't! üòä üòáüòáüòáüòáüòáüòáüòáüòáüòáüòáüòáüòáüòáüòáüòá

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Can‚Äôt register
body: I called after visiting a large pharmacy chain for a headache - they walked me to a walk in centre after being very concerned about a side of my face being twisted , the walk in wanted me to go straight into an emergency department. Instead of going there I called to register at my first GP in 30 plus years.   I was given a long list of what I needed to bring ( photo ID, proof of address etc) and was told that this would take around a week and then I could make an appointment .  Whoever I spoke to seemed really very bored and disinterested and didn‚Äôt ask if I needed to see a doctor.    I felt I would be better off not bothering as this was really poor PR - and that‚Äôs meant to be the best side of any business

title: I could not have asked for better
body:
I was referred for a colonoscopy and being my first, felt extremely apprehensive.  I could not have asked for better care and treatment. The time from seeing my GP to having the colonoscopy was under two weeks. My appointment was made to take place at Solihull Hospital, close to where I live, so avoiding the extra hassle of having to travel to and return from a hospital further away. 
Every staff member I encountered from the endoscopy reception until I was discharged was caring, helpful and reassuring. Clear explanations were provided at each stage of the process and I had complete confidence in them during the whole process. 
Everything was centred on my needs and I was definitely treated as an individual and not just someone on a "conveyer belt" system.  Timings were good and my partner was kept fully informed.
The final example of a personal touch was receiving a follow up telephone call the day after from one of the staff involved in my procedure to check on how I was and if I had any questions.
YOU WERE ALL BRILLIANT and I am so grateful.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great first impression
body: Easy booking process. A doctor called me and was very helpful and thorough. Appointment found later that day. Arrived before appointment and went in on time. Friendly and helpful (same Dr). Follow up actions organised and was on my way. NHS gets so much negativity but this is why we need to appreciate the service. Can‚Äôt recommend the medical team enough.

title: Needs managing
body:
Signed up to Patient Access as encouraged to do so mam by the practice. However for the past 3 prescriptions I have not only had to make telephone calls but also had to make visits to the surgery in order to get the prescription signed. What is the point in having the service if it is not going to be used by the doctors. Total waste of time. 
It‚Äôs a busy practice but reception staff need to pay attention to their patients, not on their mobiles while there‚Äôs a cue at reception! A good Practice Manager should be able to sort a lot of the problems out.

title: Quick professional cading
body: I was seen straightaway. I was assessed and referred for physiotherapy. I telephoned and got an appointment with a physio within a week. I could not fault the service I received, really caring people.

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Completely clueless
body: I never got to see a doctor. My GP referred me to see a consultant. I was given an appointment for five months in the future. Three weeks before I was supposed to attend I received a letter saying my appointment had been rescheduled - for a date I couldn't make. When I rang to rearrange it I was told the next available appointment was in six months time. I asked why my appointment had been changed and was told it was because the consultant had given the hospital four days notice before taking annual leave. I asked could I see another doctor but was told that since it was my first visit to the clinic I had to see the consultant. Since the new appointment would have meant a year's wait since my GP referred me and since it was likely that you would again  arbitrarily change the appointment I told the rude and unhelpful woman who answered the phone to cancel it altogether. You are completely useless. I see the health service is now in the grip of a wacky Japanese management ideology called Kaizen which is Japanese for Improve. Perhaps if you paid less attention to buzzwords and more to just doing the basics, things would get back to how they were in the 1960s when I was first diagnosed with my lung disease. Then things worked fairly well.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Not very speedy
body: my aid went down just before Christmas and a nice man came and fixed it, except he never had a tube long enough and said he would get one before Christmas, that never happened so Christmas spoiled, new year spoiled too, man came in new year with new tube, (had to send away for it) he said. Then the man said hearing aid was not programmed properly and took it away, end of January now and still no aid. I thought they programmed it on the laptop that they always have with them. Oh yes, nearly forgot, they lent me an aid but that has failed, long time to be without an aid, verdict ....Rubbish Service....

title: Absolutely fantastic surgery!
body: I wouldn't consider anywhere else for mine or my children's GP surgery. We have always received prompt appointments and at reception the phone is always answered and conversations are friendly and understanding. Doctors and nursing staff are professional, empathetic and knowledgeable.

title: Needs improvement
body:
I suffer from severe anxiety and severe depression. My mum had had to called the access crisis team quite a few times. 

One time was due to my thoughts of self injury and that I was struggling to deal with them. They simply told my mum to wait until I start my counselling, which I was on the waiting list for and it could take 6 months. 

I also struggle to talk to people over the phone due to my anxiety so I am unable to answer questions e.c.t. they literally just refuse to help due to this. Saying that theres nothing they can do. Even though you can tell that I am struggling considering I struggle to communicate through phone calls. Due to this, I cant tell them what my symptoms are anyhow I am feeling properly as i freeze up and refuse to speak. There should be a text message service for people who suffer with anxiety so it less stressful and so they can talk about their problems in more detail rather than freaking out over the phone and hang up e.c.t. Or actually try and arrange a day to come in and talk to someone in person. It's like that they think just because we are adults, that we don't suffer from anxiety and need support to talk to someone over the phone. 

The only okay thing that they did was agree that I needed to go on antidepressants and said that they would contact my GP asap so I can be put on them, without the GP worrying about putting me on them. However, when I went to book an appointment to see my GP, they told me that they havent received a phone call or anything off Harplands. I was quite lucky to have an amazing doctor that properly diagnosed me with my mental illnesses and did me a prescription for my antidepressants.

readBy.name: North Staffordshire Combined Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Outstanding care and compassion
body:
My father was admitted for day case surgery (ENT) at Kidderminster Hospital in December 2019
The care he received was outstanding from ALL staff and as a 94 year old he was treated with kindness patience dignity and respect 
We as his family could not have asked for better care and would like to thank all the staff involved 
He also sees the nurse specialist from this department on a regular basis She is so caring and kind towards him and totally respectful and professional in the treatment she delivers

readBy.name: Worcestershire Acute Hospitals NHS Trust

title: No complaints.
body:
Me and my family have been patients at this surgery for around 40 years, in which time i can say we have never  had reason to make a complaint.
I understand in these modern times things are more dificult in the N H S.
However yesterday at 8.00 am i rang for an appointment by 8.08 i had an appointment in place for 9.45. I saw a doctor on time was very pleased with my treatment and was given a follow up appointment for the next week. I am extremely satisfied with the service i received and  i know that there may be gasps of surprise but i can only speak as I find many thanks to all concerned, 10 out of 10 and a gold star.

title: Cataract removal
body:
Generally, the experience was favourable but there were three issues.
1. My appointment time on 24/01/20 was 8.30 am. I arrived at 8.10am, and there was just one other patient there before me. However, it was not until 11.30 am approx that my surgery actually commenced. It was very irritating to witness lots of other people being dealt with before me. I suspect that when I arrived, my papers were transferred from one pile to start another pile. As subsequent people arrived, their papers were put on top of mine, and so on. The pile of papers were then tackled by the next section working from the top of the pile and thus, I went from first position to virtually last. This was quite annoying and could easily be rectified if the papers were stacked properly or alternatively marked with the patient‚Äôs arrival time and then processed in that order.
2. The supplied instructions detail how to get into the car park but not how to get out. I have been stuck in the car park twice now.
3. One of the waiting rooms I was directed to was very cold, and it was only when I complained to a member of staff that this problem was addressed.
I hope you accept these comments in the spirit they are offered and I am sure that with a little thought, your service will can be improved.

title: Brilliant staff and care.
body:
My husband and I visited the department last night. He has some longstanding health problems which puts him at risk of infection and he was feeling unwell. 
I cannot praise the staff enough. They were attentive, kind and clinically competent. He has a fairly rare underlying condition which needs specific treatment when he‚Äôs ill and they were knowledgeable about that,  giving sound advice and treating him appropriately and correctly.
From the reception staff right through to the nursing and medical staff, he received excellent care, expertise and kindness. 

Thanks!

readBy.name: North Bristol NHS Trust
NHS Bristol, North Somerset and South Gloucestershire CCG

title: Professional and excellent service from all the‚Ä¶
body: I arrived at 7 am (17/01/2029) at the appropriate Ward and was met by Ward sister who was most welcoming and friendly and put me in my ease. The treatment was carried out in a most professional way and I was delighted with the result and service. I am extremely grateful to all the Staff who looked after me so well on that day. Kind regards, Patrick Kennedy

readBy.name: Imperial College Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Excellent in all respects
body: Widcombe surgery is professional, efficient and welcoming.  One of us has been a patient there for more than 10 years. The doctors are all very good. Our  doctor in particular is brilliant !! We feel very lucky to have him.  His diagnoses are all spot on and he listens carefully to us as patients and discusses various forms of treatment  and follows everything up.  The nurses are also professional with high expertise and warmth and the receptionists are friendly and efficient. I would say this is a very well run practice. Real care is taken of patients rather than adopting a conveyor belt approach. Thank you Widcombe Surgery.

author: Clan
title: Poor Communication
body:
My husband has been recovering from illness for a few months now and asked for a private referral to be arranged.  
I personally chased this a week later to be told it was done the previous week. I chased again later that week as still no sign of the letter to be told it was showing it was done but could not physically see the letter on screen. A phone call later we were told it wasn't done and the doctor will sort it.  
I rang again (now being 15 days waiting) to be told by a very abrupt member of staff that they cannot disclose any information to me as I am not my husband and all they could say is the letter was done approximately 2 weeks before - to which I said it wasn't as past conversations I have had with the staff confirmed this and how come staff have discussed this with me if I am not allowed to speak with them?  
My husband is now having to take time out of his busy work schedule to attempt to ring the surgery and get an answer.  
I feel the service at this surgery is just unbelievable, not only trying to get an appointment, waiting up to 15mins just to get through to someone but now this.

title: Wonderful staff
body: I had a mastectomy on Monday following a cancer diagnosis - I'll admit to being terrified but the brilliant and caring staff made it much easier to get through. To all ladies expecting to have the same procedure, it is doable. Someone will be looking after you every step of the way. My sincere thanks to all the members of the breast unit team, everyone on the admissions ward, all the brilliant theatre staff (including the recovery room) and all the staff on ward 1b. Whether you are nurses, surgeons, consultants, doctors, health care assistants, porters or the lady who fed and watered me, you should all be proud of your work. Thank you.

readBy.name: United Lincolnshire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Amazing practice
body: The Surgery and the staff are simply amazing.  They are incredibly accommodating in respect of finding appts and supportive when the practice is at it‚Äôs busiest.  They are certainly a practice that should be used as a role model to other surgeries.

title: my time at Russells hall
body: in December 2019 i was took to Russells Hall Hospital and from the ambulance service to the A & E it was first class service i was in because of my heart AF and with all the test i had in the end it was my thyroid causing the problems, fast heart rate, feeling clammy dizzy, so i just want to thank all the staff and the cardiology department  for the care you give me, i'm on the mend now thanks to you all............

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: never had any responce from urgent matter
body: left Worthing hospital after having surgery wanted to find out about antibiotics prescribed by the hospital, so rang reception she said would find out and call me back, waited 2 hours no response, rang again was told the doctor has been informed but no contact back, this was on 23/1 2020   now this is sat 25/1 2020 still no contact from doctor, so had to make my way back to hospital because of a vein that had come up due to infection in leg, couldn't take the tablets prescribed so thought would ring my doctors but no one has got back, this was urgent, had to ring 111 because of vein up and had to go and see them.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Sussex

title: Unable to contact the nursing home by phone
body:
In recent times I have found that virtually every time I call the nursing home to speak to staff regarding my mother my call is not answered.  This happens regardless of time of day or day of the week.  Today, 25th January 2020 I have phoned 4 times and the call has been timed out in every case.  It was particularly important that I made contact in this case as I wanted to ensure prior to visiting there were no viruses etc. as I have other family members to whom I cannot risk passing such things on to.

The lack of a voicemail facility to pass on messages is very poor in this day and age.

title: Great team
body: The anaesthetist team where absolutely phenomenal at keeping me calm before putting me to sleep. The decor very team where lovely. Every nurse that dealt with me where fantastic and respectful and my consultant was very informative .

title: Calm, reassuring and kind
body: The two male paramedics that came out to my granddaughter on 25/1 were so kind and professional. They were so lovely to her and didn‚Äôt make me feel stupid for calling them out.

readBy.name: South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic
body: I went to hospital on the 23rd January 2020 for operation, I went on the day stay ward, and from the moment I went on the ward I was looked after very well, all the nurses was great, they treated everyone with respect, before I went down for the surgery the doctor came round and explained what was going to happen, I just want to say a great big thank you,

readBy.name: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very slow service
body: Without being rude been sat here over 4 hours the initial triage system was fine and quick and that's when.it went down hill  just nothing happening nobody being called In Regularly nurses standing around appearing to not do anything reception bit rude if honest and unhelpful others feeling the same some been here longer than us I don't like dissing the NHS as they on the whole do a great job but surely A+E could be quicker turn around it's supposed to be quicker than years gone but sorry it doesn't feel that way

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent practice
body: Ultra sound  quick efficient  very professional informative  no waiting around for appointment went on on time sorted in 10 minutes

title: Swift diagnosis and amazing care
body: My husband was admitted 14 November in a state GCS 3. The swift diagnosis of a brain hemorage and immediate transfer to RVI for surgery saved his life. I cannot thank the amazing paramedics all 5 of them that attended my home and made the decision to take him to Sunderland Royal, the caring and professional staff in Emergency A&E who took care of him and ensured I was kept up to speed with everything that was happening. The staff who went with him on the transfer to the RVI.  He was in hospital for 5 weeks before being allowed home on 21 December and am so pleased to say that although a long process he is doing amazingly well. The RVI staff called him Mr Miracle. That goes along way to the amazing NHS staff we have working in our hospitals.   Thank you all from the whole family and especially the new addition that arrived on 2nd January that he will get to know his grandad

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful service
body: I took my daughter today with a very infected ear after having her ears pierced in Dec, earring had become embedded in lobe overnight and couldn‚Äôt remove at home, too painful. The receptionist was very friendly, the triage nurse a little gruff, the practitioner who treated my daughter was amazing, explained to her what he needed to and made her daughter to somewhat alleviate a horrible experience for her. He was also non judgemental. Second time I have used this fantastic service.

title: Appreciation
body:
My wife an I write this in appreciation of the care we have received from Elm tree surgery. Small though in size, the service provided is impressive. Doctors are efficient and compassionate, supporting staff friendly and pleasant. 
Both of us being elderly, our health needs are varied from physical to psychological and frequently too. We are thankful for the care received and wish the practice progress.

title: Excellent Service
body: Within the last two weeks I have had reason to call the medical centre to ask for assistance.  On the first occasion it was to ask for advice given my husband's illness was deteriorating.  The receptionist was kind and efficient in her summary of the situation and arranged for a response team paramedic to attend.  He was very good and thorough in his tests....keeping me informed in language I could understand and not at all patronising.  His care, advice and concern for me and my husband was excellent.  Some week later, unfortunately, my husband's condition deteriorated again, on this occasion to a frightening level.  Once more the medical centre receptionist was efficient in her responses and concerned for me also.  She arranged for the paramedic, who visited before, to ring me and talk me through the situation.  Which he did with excellent recall of our circumstances.  As he was not on the visiting team that day he arranged for another member of the response team to visit on this occasion.  She was also excellent.  Very thorough in her tests and all the while reassuring me while waiting for an ambulance to take us to the hospital.  I wanted it known that all those that attended us on those occasions were professional and gave us the time and concern we required despite the heavy demands made on their services.  A credit to them and a credit to our NHS. We have been patients of this surgery for a number of years and this is not an isolated case of their good service.  My thanks to all.

title: Great a and e
body: My husband was seen by a@e within half an hour of arriving at the department, he was assessed by the nurse practitioner who then booked him a appointment at a Cosham surgery to be seen by a gp as there was a 6-7 hours to be seen at QA , he was seen by the gp within half an hour , I would like to say a big thank you to all the staff involved wat a great and efficient service .

readBy.name: Portsmouth Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Excellent Service
body: Yesterday had (cancellation appointment) Cataract surgery, had exception treatment and attention on Ward 2 and theatre thanks to all the teams. Also, from reception lady who took us to the ward.  Very much appreciated. Thanks to the NHS...

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Awful service
body: I have newly registered with this GP. It has been 2 months I have now been with this GP. And I have not been given an appointment. Every time I ring I am fobbed off. I work monday to friday and when I try to do outside my working hours its a no. Which GP does not offer appointments!? The most awful GP i have been registered with. I will be leaving this GP. Awful awful service.

title: Chest X-Ray
body: My elderly father attended for a chest X-ray, although the staff were very nice and helpful I was disappointed with the facilities. The changing room chair was inadequate, very low & difficult to stand up from, as there was nowhere to hold on to. The gown he had to wear for the X-ray was of a poor design. He had to put it over his head, which was very difficult. He‚Äôd expected a gown that had a back opening or slit back, which would have been less difficult for him to get on. This and the chair problem made it very frustrating for him.

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body:
I've been registered at Abbeywell Surgery for many years.  Even during the merger when there were problems I've had amazing care and given regular appointments for chronic health problems.  I've seen a lot of different members of the team over the years and the large majority have been really helpful and kind.  

Now that the new econsult system is in place everything seems to run a lot more smoothly and the practice are very quick to respond when you need same day treatment.

title: Unable to register
body: Tried to register here by calling in in person after going to a pharmacy with a headache and a dropped side of my face -  I was told to go ASAP to an emergency department , but they were thinking stroke symptoms and it‚Äôs not! I was given the registration paperwork ( I couldn‚Äôt see it anyway!) but asked to provide lots of documentary ID.    I simply don‚Äôt have what they needed so unable to register.

title: Consistent issues with pharmacy
body: Have been having problems for the last couple of months with the prescription/ pharmacy services, last month my husband went to collect his medication at FMP and they couldn‚Äôt be found (we did later receive a phone call saying they had found them and all was sorted) this month we have come across another issue, we handed in our prescription at FMP for it to be collected at ASDA pharmacy as opening hours are more convenient with our working hours and low and behold we go to collect them today and Asda don‚Äôt have it, the prescription has been sent to st aldhelms pharmacy which is not we had asked for we had clearly marked the medication and location we wanted and still this service couldn‚Äôt be given.... myself, my husband and our children will be moving to a different surgery simply because it‚Äôs now getting silly how something so simple can be messed up with, so now my husband has to go without very important medication over the weekend because of it..... sort it out

title: IT Man ~ Well Done
body:
First of all I would have left 5 stars but this page doesn‚Äôt let me. üò° Spent all day trying to workout how but there isn‚Äôt a way....

My review for Bilton Medical Centre!

I‚Äôve being trying to sort out my system online for 6 months now and each time the receptionist resets my password I login, change my password etc. Then I log out and login again with my new password and it‚Äôs not recognised and it locks me out again. 

Today I saw the IT specialist and he introduced me to the NHS app and set up my user name etc. I‚Äôve set this up and it‚Äôs brilliant. I just don‚Äôt understand why the receptionist aren‚Äôt offering this service to the patients. Anyway, just want to say well done Mr IT man. You‚Äôve sorted out my problem that I‚Äôve experienced for months.  

Thank you

title: Shocking
body: Again my grandmother waited 6.5 hours for an ambulance then another 9 hours waiting to be seen on arrival at Frimley Park Hospital after having to be readmitted. The management need to look into this, she‚Äôs 86 years old ... this is awful service. NHS is on its knees!

readBy.name: Frimley Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body: Atended after cutting my finger on a chop saw, was met by extremely pleasant staff and seen within 5 minutes of arriving. Nurses made me feel at ease, cleaned and dressed my wound. Wouldn't hesitate to use this service again. Thank you for all your help, NHS is an amazing service.

title: perscriptions
body: every month I put the same prescription and never get it all soi have the running around to get my medication once accident but this keeps happening its not good enough especially when its a repeat every month

title: Amazing care
body: My partner has been to resus a/e Cambridge k ward the discharge lounge and looked after by channel day care until transport came the staff here are amazing we have been given brilliant care by all departments and all staff been treated with dignity and utmost respect by all thank you to all at William Harvey hospital.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Glad I opted for Spire
body: I had a hip replaced at Spire and could not have been treated more professionally and sympathetically. I. Had a lovely room and was looked after really well by the nursing staff. The thing that most surprised me was coming round from the epidural to hear the consultant on the phone assuring my wife that everything was fine and telling her to come visit. Well done Spire and thank you!

readBy.name: Spire Healthcare

title: Amazing practice
body: A friend of ours was on Haven ward, first class care, wonderful staff very understanding and caring towards my friend. They played a great part in her recovery from her illness. Chine ward where she moved from is amazing too, they really look after their patients and care.

readBy.name: Dorset HealthCare University NHS Foundation Trust

title: So far 12 hours waiting for a bed
body: My dad has dementia was found on the floor early morning  so rushed to a&e with no mobility retention and rapid heart rate he‚Äôs been told they‚Äôre admitting him but he‚Äôs been waiting 12 hours for a bed even though a man who walked into a&e has a bed my dad is STILL waiting even though he‚Äôs confused with his dementia

readBy.name: Plymouth University Urgent and Emergency Care Bsc (2020)

title: Great maternity care
body: Gave birth to my daughter but in February 2018 by c- section has she was breech. Excellent care from start to finish. Staff were always attentive to my needs. Staff who performed the c-section were superb and made me feel relaxed and cared for. Maternity ward staff and midwives were great and always on hand whenever I needed them. Overall I had a excellent experience considering I stayed  there for a week. Also the food was lovely and the ward was always clean.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Continual blunders mean prescriptions not filled
body:
Something is fundamentally wrong with the prescription services offered and administered at this practice.
This has been going on for months and I have finally decided to complain formally. This is an overview.

My husband and I are getting older now and have to take a fair amount of medication.
I go to the practice and order the necessary medication. I order it so the replacements should be ready about half a week before the previous supply would run out. 

Unfortunately when I go to the pharmacy there is always something missing.  This week it was 4 of my husbands items were not provided. The pharmacy always blames the practice and has commented that this issue is not isolated. Each time the pharmacy suggests you go over to discuss it, which you do and no-one can ever explain it. In addition no-one will rectify the situation at that point. You are instead made to wait another 3-4  days and have the risk of the order not being complete again when you go to the pharmacy.

There is obviously a real problem here. It is putting patients at risk through a continued set of blunders. It isn't isolated and appears that no-one is addressing the issue.

title: Excellent help and advice
body: Over the past 2 months I have had high blood glucose readings and was attempting to find a solution. I spoke with both specialist nurses. I was provided with 2 new pens which initially didn't change anything. I examined one of my new pens and there was a fault with the delivery of insulin which I rectified. Everything is now back to normal. I was quite stressed over this period and when I spoke to both nurses they were very reassuring and did help to put me at ease. I have been a patient at Downsway surgery for 18 months and have always found every member of staff to be helpful and caring. Thank you.

title: Very professional,gently treating
body: Reception was helpful and polite and the consultant has been  very professional , gentle and helped me with all my health issues.

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great dissappointment
body: My GP referred me to see a physiotherapist four times over five years. Out of four physiotherapists only one turned out to be helpful and productive. I am so grateful to this wonderful man who cared and supported me! I spend my time coming to Mary Potter Center struggling to arrange time off work. I come because I am in pain and need help. However, it is unfortunately almost always just a waste of time. They haven't got a clue. I can find better advice on You tube.

readBy.name: Nottinghamshire Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service
body: I called ahead of visit and received such understanding and compassion on the phone then came in to A&E with some eye problems and from the triage nurse to the doctor and all other staff I met in between, was treated with such kindness and care. The volume of patients must have added a lot of pressure on the staff but they all remained so calm and so considerate. Can‚Äôt praise them highly enough. Thank you.

title: Awful place - avoid
body: Sadly I have been a patient here (on and off) since I was born and it is just horrendous now. The GPs are fantastic but the support staff, receptionists, medication team etc just ignore your calls, don‚Äôt do what they will say they will and generally fob you off. You can tell them a thousand times what you need but they will still get it wrong. If you have an ongoing condition or require repeat prescriptions I would really recommend going to a different surgery. Sadly I think they really don‚Äôt care about the patient so stear clear! It‚Äôs so bad you have to question if it‚Äôs not actually their intention to get rid of patients who require ongoing treatment - cost saving perhaps.

title: Massively happy with this hospital
body: Well what can I say was taken in by ambulance following a post lumbar puncture was put into a cubicle with in 5-10 minutes of arrival seen strate away by a doctor was givin iv pain relief and fluids strate away obs was taken and blood test felt very well looked after from the time of arrival to discharge these hospitals don‚Äôt get the credit where due exceptional treatment by the nurses and doctor tonight  lovly friendly nurses and doctors thank you again for quickly sorting me out

readBy.name: Worcestershire Acute Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Great work
body:
I‚Äôve been for a dermatology appointment and I‚Äôve been pleased surprised to see the efficiency and help of the consultant who assisted me. The at after the GP had all the info. Great job and very happy finally after being disappointed with the nhs service before. 
Well done.

title: Positive experience
body: Very good experience. Appointment made within a week of GP referral, at a time suited to my circumstances. Waiting area in hospital bright ,clean and relaxed. Called into x ray department on time, all stages of x-ray explained by a caring, considerate radiographer. Thank you

readBy.name: Gloucestershire Care Services NHS Trust

title: Appreciation
body:
I was amazed to receive on Saturday morning on18th Jan that I have an infection and you have sent the prescription to Chana Chemist.
I was able collect the medicine that afternoon and start the treatment.

It is amazing that such a efficient and joined-up service despite such demands on GP's time.

By the way I have managed to write a letter of appreciation, after literally 9 years, to Ambulance Service about dealing by para-medics of my stroke. I like to thank the doctor for his encouragement.

title: Very good practice
body: Having spent a afternoon on A&E with my aunt we experienced such lovely friendly nurses , doctors and porters everyone couldn‚Äôt have done more So  helpful and friendly towards my aunt and ourselves

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Thankyou to the A&E Team when I was in a crisis!
body:
I came into hospital this morning (25th Jan) after having a  nervous breakdown and unable to keep myself safe. On arrival, the receptionist, sensitively asked me about how I was feeling. 

Then came Triage and the nurse asked me a few questions, in a way that did not make things worse. I Saw an A&E Dr after 4.6 hours, but I did mind. The department was busy. Also a nurse came out to the waiting room every couple of hours, which is good. The Dr asked me  how I felt and what had happened, which I  explained. She said I needed to go to the waiting room and mental health lesion  would come to see me soon. However, I could not collar the volunteer making brews and he did me a  lovely coffee. Me and my carer were only in the waiting room 10 mins, before mental health lesion  called me  through and I was taken to Assessment B back to Room  1, where I'd seen the doctor. The Mental Health team  were brilliant and listened to all me and my carer had to say and formulated a plan to move forward. 

But I have to give praise once again to the volunteer on the unit, as he made me and my carer a brew and bought me weetobix! He is a star!!!!!

So thankyou to all the doctors, nurses, mental health team workers and that volunteer who went above and beyond for me.

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Couldn't organise anything
body:
On Monday 20 January I collected a prescription from Solar and asked if the pharmacist could process my monthly repeat prescriptions. I was told that the surgery would no longer allow this and the only way in which I could order repeat prescriptions was directly through the surgery. I was given a two sheet printed official hand-out detailing why the surgery had taken this decision and stating that in future I must place my prescription requests in the wooden letterbox in the surgery vestibule or post them using in both cases the green prescription stub from the month previous prescription or I could post the prescription request to the surgery or I could order the items using the NHS App. The surgery would not accept verbal requests but only written requests. I walked round to the surgery with difficulty to ask; 1: What is an APP as I don't own one or have a mobile phone? 2: Who is paying for the postage if I have to use the post for the prescription request. 3: How do I manage to get down to the surgery by 10.30 as required - I am nearly 74. 4: Where do I get the green stubs from as I have lost the previous ones.
On reaching the surgery the staff did not know anything about the letter that had been sent to the Pharmacy and couldn't help me. I walked (with difficulty again) back to the Pharmacy but the pharmacist would not supply my monthly prescription because of the letter which had been issued by the surgery. A certain phrase concerning Organising a Bean Feast comes to mind but the situation now is that I am out of my medication and I cannot walk around the town ad infinitum attempting to find out what greater minds than mine are playing at.

title: Poor practice
body:
It was decided I had torn a muscle, the physio who assessed me was fantastic, caring empathetic to my symptoms and pain levels and completed a physical examination, however the nurse sat behind the screen decided to join in and advise how dangerous and overdose is with paracetamol?!? To then add no further treatment, not knowing the injury, symptoms background etc main care was to get back in waiting room..... considering I work in the care sector and have done for many years, also knowing how stretched the NHS is I would not waste their time or services, although was made to feel I did exactly that!!! Considering I provide services to more vulnerable members of our community, and tonight due to my injuries was vulnerable myself, it does make me question if it is the right service to use or just make sure they aren't working...
Although they were very busy, I dont see this as an excuse for the way I was treated or made to feel, i had contacted 111 who booked the appointment then i waited almost 2 hours to be seen, not  moaning or grumbling about this more sympathetic to the working shift.

readBy.name: Oxford Health NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Big thanks, Cannot praise enough.
body: Took my Daughter for a bad infection in her thumb. We barely had time to sit down before we were called in. Numbed, cut and drained and issued antibiotics all within 10 minutes. The guy who dealt with her was so amazing, we both couldn't stop praising him enough. She said she wished there was a way of giving good feedback to how great he was and here we are. Nearing the end of a busy day where they had seen over 150 people, his attitude was brilliant. Thank you for your help today and all the hard work that you do. You are a Hero amongst Heroes.

title: Fantastic Department
body:
I had a day stay at the Day stay surgery department 
I could not fault the place ,right from phone call to book appointment 
To the actual surgery ,
I had a hernia repair it was almost like i was a vip patient 
i was treated so well 
Nurses were fantastic 
They informed me about things all day
When op was over i was offered tea or any drink i wanted
Sandwich or biscuits 
I can honestly say they was the best &  should be proud of this 
Thank you so much

readBy.name: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: great care
body: Thank you so much to the ambulance crew who attended my husband's fall from a ladder, and to the hospital staff in A@E. So patient and kind.

readBy.name: Salisbury NHS Foundation Trust

title: A practice that does not care
body: I've been asking for help for months now. I just get told by the doctor and receptionist staff to get on with and get used to it. There is no one that cares or even listens to you. Cant get an appointment. Even if you ring at 8 they have all gone! You have to suffer for over a week to get in. Then the doctors don't even care!

title: GP & Nurses Top Notch
body:
I‚Äôve been using this surgery for over a decade and have always been satisfied with the delivery of their service . GPs Nurses Triage all fabulous apart from 1 GP but what let‚Äôs this practise down is the lack of compassion or understanding by the receptionists. The last year has been atrocious to say the least and considering they‚Äôre front line to the practise they should be on point like the maturer ladies that once occupied the desk!
They do not understand or (don‚Äôt want to ) that mental health or complex issues especially is hard without having 50 questions thrown at you and if your not responding in the manner they want they soon start saying ‚Äú your not listening to them ‚Äú or your becoming ‚Äúaggressive ‚Äú and that unless we explain what the problem is they can‚Äôt help you ! I‚Äôm sorry but I don‚Äôt want to talk to you about it  and when you ask them to get the GP on call to contact you they say I need to put something down for them to know the nature of the call . We have a choice what we want to disclose and what we don‚Äôt .
I‚Äôve also had issues with repeat prescriptions and inaccurate appointments booked and now I tend to avoid at all costs unless I‚Äôm really unwell . That‚Äôs if your lucky to see a GP and heaven help you if you want to see your own one .
For a practise that could be exceptional it‚Äôs mediocre now and nothing is changing .

Female GPS and nurses outstanding ! They‚Äôre what keeps with practise afloat .

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Disappointed and ignored by the staff
body: I waited an hour to see the consultant although I was on time and had an appointment booked in advance weeks earlier. During the consultation, the consultant ignored my request for a drink of water and said if I needed one then I can go and buy a cup of coffee and she was going to see another patient. I asked only for some water as I was there waiting for a full hour without anything to drink, no water machine or access to drinking water. I asked if she could ask a nurse to bring some water for me so I didn't miss my appointment but she/the doctor refused. Then she was on the phone for half of my consultation telling me that she was on call and had to take those calls. It was really upsetting and embarrassing for me even more that I had to listen to other people's/patients' medical issues while sitting opposite which was actually quite distressing as they about were leukaemia and some critical patients. The consultant did not find it inappropriate or unprofessional and I felt like a nuisance while she was on the phone although it was my own consultation time. She would also ask me questions in between the calls but did not seem to listen or interested in my answers. At the end she said she may see me before Christmas which was in two weeks time and then refer me for a biopsy and ct scan. However, I did not see her until six weeks later and had no biopsy arranged. I only got a letter for a ct scan only which was not explained to me at all by her or anyone else beforehand and I simply was too scared and unsure about to go through with. Lastly, when I asked the nurse whilst waiting about a toilet she pointed me to some door that was not marked as one and I couldn't open it as it was locked. When I tried to ask her to help me or show me another toilet she just ignored me, smirked and walked away. Summing up, no access to toilets, drinking water, information on how long the waiting time was going to be and why and once in, the consultant is more preoccupied and concerned with the calls than the patient in front of her. I do not even know how to describe it the whole experience apart from as a terrible one.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Consultant and his team
body: I have been under the consultant‚Äôs care for a year. I have always found him to be professional and respectful. He explained everything fully and presented the options and did not rush consultations. The consultant undertook surgery to improve my vision and restore the appearance of my eye using techniques that I had not thought possible many years after childhood surgery. The results are beyond my expectations and I am very grateful to him and his team.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Wonderful ladies in reception!
body: My doctor is a caring compassionate doctor who listens to your problems. He is very efficient and reassuring to have him at the surgery.  The ladies in reception are always kind , and try to help you in any way they can.

title: Poor treatment
body: I stayed at Nuffield health Plymouth and had cosmetic surgery. My surgeon was amazing, couldn‚Äôt ask for anyone better. Very reassuring and made me feel at ease before and after the operation. After I came out of recovery I was anxious when my family left me. I had observations done at 21:00pm or around that time. I couldn‚Äôt settle due to having tubes in my nose and I couldn‚Äôt breathe properly. I seen every hour on the clock. I didn‚Äôt see any members of staff during the night until I called my bell and asked for something to help me sleep (which was refused). I was so upset and being on my own after such a big procedure is daunting. A member of staff came in early hours in the morning asking how I‚Äôd slept. Nice of them to ask throughout the night. The food was not good atall, served cold. Considering the amount I paid to have an insecurity fixed my experience was slightly ruined. It‚Äôs a big shame.

readBy.name: Nuffield Health

title: Great Practice
body:
I had occasion to visit Spamedica on Saturday 25.1.2020 as a patient.
I can honestly state that it was a wonderful experience, all down to the staff. I have never met such polite, professional staff in my life.
They made my visit such an enjoyable and stress free event.
From the beginning to the end. Thank you so much......

title: No understanding of endometriosis
body:
I had severe endometriosis that had recently been diagnosed and went to A&E with a ruptured large endometrioma on my ovary. I had rebound tenderness, 10/10 pain, nausea and vomiting, a fever and eventually my blood test showed inflammation. On arriving, the receptionist smirked at me when I told her what was wrong. When I eventually saw the triage nurse he told me off for not having taken an ibuprofen. For 10/10 pain and internal bleeding. I was left waiting for hours sat on a hard plastic chair, in agony. With drunk patients with minor injuries pushing past me constantly. When my blood test eventually came back showing inflammation I was finally believed and an apologetic nurse took me to a bed. A doctor came to see me and tried again to send me home with ibuprofen. I had to explain to him what an endometrioma is, what happens when it ruptures, that I needed a scan and to see a gynaecologist. More hours later, after a CT scan showed internal haemorrhaging, as I had already explained it would, an apologetic gynaecologist admitted me and I was kept in for 2 nights for pain management and monitoring my haemoglobin. The consultant said I would need emergency surgery but fortunately I had excision surgery booked in the following week with accredited endometriosis specialists in Surrey. As there are none in Sussex.

Endometriosis affects 5% of the population. It is unacceptable that there was so little knowledge of the condition amongst the staff. I had particularly severe disease, and an emergency situation, but was treated like a time waster with normal period pain. Other patients with the same problem might not have been in a position to advocate for themselves in order to get basic medical treatment. I suggest the A&E department has some training in endometriosis as well as unconscious bias training and stops dismissing female patients and ignoring their symptoms.

readBy.name: Digestive Diseases Centre, Royal Sussex County Hospital
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: staff and care second to none
body:
My husband had to have a second angiogram after moving house and county. The first one he had was in the torbay area of the country . 
This week he had a very positive outcome with all staff highly recommended from the receptionist to the surgeons . Everything explained to us everything quickly done with no hanging around or wondering .. we did have reservations not knowing the hospital , hearing  and reading some reviews . Not anymore . Highly recommended and can I say we made friends with a super nurse we shall be sad not to see again . We hope not anyway .. meant in the nicest possible way . . Thank you to everyone who took care of him and who will still be monitoring him in the future

readBy.name: Kettering General Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Bad service
body: Was waiting 1 hour 45 mind for Triage that's ok , bloods taken told results would be an hour , chased after 2 was yold by reception needed to see doctor, not a and r doctor,  advised just need blood tests- should add they had been tested in A&E so was easy results , staff said I had to wait, long story and swig short 8 hours tes 8 hours senior doctor apologised I had slipped through the net! The staff on duty would not listen when I told them I was just waiting for results,  they made out they checked when it was confirmed they had not,  it was only after 7 hours and demanding to see someone that the senior doctor saw us apologised,  and advised the front staff had let them down,   I thanked him but also advised I had told the staff this , even when the handover happened  shocking service,  disgusting staff who use there do called power to do nothing.   I normally support them but in this instance I a. Not.  I will never go back warrington again   if asked y simple I dont like the attitude of the staff , the state of the waiting area  the lack of information.    Lastly I want to point out ITS THE RECEPTION STAFF THIS IS ABOUT NOT THE MEDICAL TEAM the front house staff let the hospital down and need training as being there that long I saw how they talked and treated patients - not nice at all

readBy.name: North Cheshire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Bright, clean, modern facility
body: I visited this property on 25/01/2020 to assess it's suitability for my 90 year old mother's care. The staff were helpful and friendly and the property appeared well maintained. Unfortunately, I have been unable to find any reviews for this nursing home save for the many CQC ratings stating 'Requires Improvement'. The CQC rating was carried out in September 2019 and its report was published in October 2019.  Can anyone please give an up to date review of this nursing home to assist with my decision as to whether or not to place my mother there?

title: Disappointed
body:
I fell down the stair on the 20th Dec.
I then went to A & E on the 26th Dec as my ankle was swollen and painful.
I was told that it wasn‚Äôt broken and to be careful and should take another week.
On the 22nd Jan I went to my GP as it was still swollen and painful, I was then sent for a X-ray.
I was told I have a Avulasion fracture.
I was then told they would speak to A & E about them seeing me, but he was told because it was an old injury, they referred me back to my GP.
Who will now refer me to the fracture clinic of which I have no clue of how long it will take to get an appointment.
So if anyone does review this review.
How do I get an urgent appointment at the fracture clinic.

Thanks
Mrs Sharon Stone

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Everything is now so bright and colourful
body:
I have had cataracts removed from both eyes and I was surprised how bright and colourful everything was after the operation. All along, everybody was most helpful and the Consultant clearly and simply explained the process so that I knew what to expect on the day. Hospitals are under a lot of pressure these days, but in spite of this my experience was only positive. 
The worst thing has been trying to find  parking space on busy days!

readBy.name: James Paget University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent practice with great doctors and a‚Ä¶
body: Our family practice for 18 years, great support from both doctors and nurses for our whole family through some difficult times.

title: Going downhill
body:
I have seen all of the GPs at this surgery and can safely say that there‚Äôs only one doctor that I would see, one other seems to be very business-like and lacking bedside manner, the other 2 seem quite inexperienced and at a loss of what to say. 
The reception staff at both the Pultney and Bathampton leave a lot to be desired! They are the first point of contact for patients who are in a vulnerable position (hence needing help and calling) and often they make you feel even worse! One receptionist in particular is very rude and unprofessional and treats you as if you are inconveniencing her and asking her a personal favour, not merely what‚Äôs in her job description. The others aren‚Äôt very friendly too, apart from one receptionist at Pultney St whom I haven‚Äôt seen recently.  I couldn‚Äôt believe the attitude of one receptionist when I popped over to request a GP call back (I was dropping off my children at the nearby school and was passing in front of the surgery). She asked me to telephone the surgery. I asked whether the reason she‚Äôs asking me to call is because Pultney Practice answers the calls; she said ‚Äònot necessarily‚Äô. I pointed out that as i was passing by on my way home, it makes no difference if Bathampton answers the calls but she stuck with her script. It was absurd! I stepped out of the surgery, got my mobile out and called and got her colleague who sat right next to her answer the call, took my details and rudely said there was no chance of a GP calling me that day as they have a backlog so best to ring first thing the next day! I was left speechless and perplexed at the absurdity of this whole interaction!
The management really need to invest in customer service training!

title: no confidence in level of care available
body: Following a necessary visit to Guys critical care unit, I was advised I needed to arrange regular follow up care with a nurse at my GPs. I was lucky to get a cancellation for the required two days time. The nurse was not very organised and didn't seem to have anything she needed. I had been given some spare medihoney at Guys, so asked if this could be used as the practice didn't have any. There were no waterproof dressings available and the dressing I ended up with was a cobbled together from a larger one. I was left feeling distressed and vulnerable. I was told to make an appointment for 2 days time but, as ever, nothing was available so I am now making appointments via the Lister extra hours facility directly. It almost seems pointless having to register at a GP when they cannot provide any of the continuous care you need. I have become increasingly frustrated by access to a GP (particularly if I wanted a female GP) and any sense of actual care for any of my medical needs. I am looking at available practices elsewhere and will be moving as soon as I reasonably can do so.

title: I needed a CT Scan.
body: Sometimes, people can be quite critical about their experiences of a particular hospital or department, sometimes justified, and sometimes not, so I have to admit to having had some reservations about attending QA.  However, on yesterday's experience, I can honestly say I now feel much more condfident about needing to have an operation at QA.   Firstly, I didn't feel a thing when the cannula was put in - and I have had some very uncomfortable experiences of this in the past in another hospital, with staff who simply couldn't seem to find a vein, or appear to care less how uncomfortable it was, so I know it isn't always that easy. Then, when I felt a bit sick and dizzy after the scan I was offered tea and biscuits.  Also, the staff couldn't have been nicer and  made sure I was OK to go home before letting me leave.  I know this was only a very minor procedure, but having seen just how lovely the staff are, I now feel far less apprehensive about my next visit which will mean an operation, though this will obviously  be far more stressful and probably quite painful.  I have had several hospital stays in the past and know that it is the attitude of the staff that makes all the difference.  When I had a total hip replacement at another hospital last year it was the kindness and care of the vast majority of the staff that made the whole procedure, painful as it was, much easier to endure. Only the one nurse who filled me with dread every time saw her approach gave anything less that the care you would hope for.  I'm afraid she was a bully and completely without sympathy.  It is the attitude of the staff every time that even helps with the healing process I believe, so having met such kind and caring people yesterday in the CT department, even though very busy, gives one  hope that staff in other departments will be equally kind, and  helps one feel so much more confident about the hospital.  Thank you everyone in the CT department, if they are all like you I shall be fine.

readBy.name: Portsmouth Hospitals NHS Trust
